items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Swale, Cod Beck, Bedale Beck

items.message: The flood alert for the Lower Swale has been removed as levels continue to fall. Further showers are expected this evening, Sunday 23/05/21, which we are continuing to monitor.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester

floodArea.county: Cheshire West and Chester, Flintshire, Shropshire, Wrexham

items.message: River levels remain high at the Farndon river gauge following heavy rainfall and are expected to rise further following forecast rainfall this afternoon and evening. We believe there is a possibility of flooding for low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days and possibly continue to rise, with further rain forecast this evening, 23/05/21. Please be aware that access to Townfield Lane could be cut off due to high river levels. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring weather forecasts and river levels, and will issue Flood Warnings if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, be aware of your surroundings and keep up to date with the current situation. This message will be updated tomorrow, Monday 24th May, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but are currently falling at the Brokenborough river gauge as a result of rainfall on Thursday and Friday. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible until Tuesday 25/05/2021. We expect flooding to affect the road at Reybridge. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further frontal rainfall is expected from early Sunday afternoon into Sunday evening. We expect river levels to rise again in response to this rainfall and remain high into the early part of next week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 11:00 on Monday, 24/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper Ouse remains in force due to high river levels as a result of recent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of low lying footpaths, roads and farmland is possible. Levels have now peaked at the York Viking Recorder and will fall slowly through Sunday, 23/05/21. A further band of fast moving but potentially heavy showers will pass over the catchment this evening. Our incident response staff continue to closely monitor the forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated on Sunday evening, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Old Wye Bridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from Monday morning, 24/05. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations that may be affected include the A438, Byford, Bredwardine and Hereford. Predicted peaks:- Old Wye Bridge 3.0m to 3.3m Monday morning, 24/05, Ross on Wye 2.9m to 3.3m Monday evening, 24/05. No flooding is expected at other gauge locations.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to begin rising Monday morning, 24/05.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 10:00, 24/05/21 or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible later this evening, 23/05/21.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road.  Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high tomorrow, 24/05/21.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 24/05/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper River Derwent catchment remains in force as river levels remain high as a result of recent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of low lying roads and farmland is possible through Sunday and into Monday, 24/05/21. The area most at risk is low lying land around Low Marishes, where levels have now stabilised. Further showers are expected on Sunday evening which are expected to keep levels high. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated on Sunday evening, 23/05/2021 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ouse at York - riverside properties
items.message: The flood warning for the York Riverside properties has been removed as levels on the Ouse continue to fall. A flood alert remains in force for the area. The level of the River Ouse in York is currently 2.7m, and is falling slowly throughout Sunday 23/5/21. A further band of rain is forecast for this evening, which we expect to cause levels to rise again into Monday, but this is not currently forecast to reach flood warning levels. Our incident response staff are continuing to closely monitor the forecast.

The flood warning for the River Ouse at Naburn Lock has been removed as levels on the Ouse continue to fall. A flood alert remains in force for the area. The level of the River Ouse in York is currently 2.7m, and is falling slowly throughout Sunday 23/5/21. A further band of rain is forecast for this evening, which we expect to cause levels to rise again into Monday, but this is not currently forecast to reach flood warning levels. Our incident response staff are continuing to closely monitor the forecast.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.
Our incident response staff are actively monitoring river levels and the weather forecast.

River levels are high but steady at the Ordsall river gauge as a result of persistent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to continue.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Goose Moor Lane at Ordsall, and farmlands in the Gamston and Eaton areas.   

Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. We expect river levels to remain high until later this evening, 23/05/21. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 24/05/21, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further light rainfall is forecast Sunday afternoon and overnight, no further impacts are expected at this stage.  
We continue to monitor the situation.
